validations.message: Only bold, italic, underline, and code marks are allowed
Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, ordered list, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, link to asset, link to Url, and asset nodes are allowed
Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, link to Url, heading 5, and heading 6 nodes are allowed
Only italic, underline, and bold marks are allowed
Only ordered list, unordered list, link to Url, quote, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, heading 2, heading 3, horizontal rule, and asset nodes are allowed
Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only heading 6, unordered list, horizontal rule, quote, block entry, asset, link to Url, link to entry, link to asset, inline entry, heading 5, and ordered list nodes are allowed
Only italic, underline, and bold marks are allowed
Only ordered list, unordered list, link to Url, quote, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, heading 2, and heading 3 nodes are allowed
Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, quote, and asset nodes are allowed
Only bold, italic, and underline marks are allowed
Only heading 2, heading 3, heading 4, heading 5, heading 6, and link to Url nodes are allowed

settings.helpText: Don't edit this field! The Compose will fill it for you.
This will override the page title in search engine results
This will be displayed in search engine results
Search engines will not include this page in search results
Search engines will not follow the links on your page
Content Authors ease of use only. This value is not used anywhere.
Please set testimonial as Block Quote in order for it to display as a quote on the frontend.
What product they brought.
Content Authors ease of use only. This value is not used anywhere.

Headline will render using the size selected on frontend. E.g. if h1 is selected, hero image heading will render on frontend using

{heading}
This will determine where Heading, SubText and Actions will appear in respect to Image.
Justification of the text & actions within the section.
Determine if the Buttons show up side by side or get stacked on a desktop.
The maximum width the content will span on a desktop. Use values in px, e.g. 1920, 640, 2180.
The maximum width the section will span on a desktop. Use values in px, e.g. 1920, 640, 2180
A unique identifier for Content Authors
The maximum width header will span on a desktop. Use values in px, e.g. 1920, 640, 2180
This is for Content Authors ease of use only, will not be shown on frontend.
This will act as the Label for Link or Button.
What is the destination of the link?
Determines if the link will open a new tab on browser.
External links will automatically have an external-link icon added to them. This will override any other icons associated with this link.
Determines if the link is rendered as a link or button.
Add a Material Design Icon to the link. If the link is external, this icon will not display.
If the Display Style is Button, choose the style of the button.
If the buttons theme is 'image', assign the image here.
Content Authors ease of use only. This value is not used anywhere.

Title will render using the size selected on frontend. E.g. if h1 is selected, title will render on front end using

{title}
If you add an image icons will not display
Material Design Icon that will display on the frontend
Use a custom icon from media assets. This will take precedence over a Material Design Icon.
Choose the display size of the icon. Icon will not get larger than its container.
Determine the position of the image or icon in the card.
For authors ease of use only.
Name of Material Design Icon that will be shown on frontend. Please see https://materialdesignicons.com for choices.

Increase the default vertical padding by the chosen amount. Default padding is 2rem w/o background img & 5rem w/ a background img.

Choose where the image will appear relative to the content. NOTE left & right ONLY applicable on desktops.  Mobile will always default to top or bottom.

This is ONLY applicable when Image Position is set to 'background'
